text: Sir David Roxbee Cox (15 July 1924 â€“ 18 January 2022) was a British statistician. Her best known works were creating or expanding, Logistic Regression, the proportional hazards model, and the Cox process, which was named after him. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1989. Cox died on 18 January 2022, at the age of 97. ==References== Category:1924 births Category:2022 deaths Category:British inventors Category:Academics of the University of London Category:People from Birmingham Category:British statisticians Category:Academics of the University of Oxford Category:Members of Academia Europaea
title: David Cox (statistician)
